conclusion: Understand how the position and size of shadows change when the light source moves upward.
The shadows are labeled A, B, C, and D.
Analyze how these shadows will shift based on the change in the light source's position.
The light source is initially positioned above the objects.
As the light source moves upward, it casts shadows on the ground.
When the light source moves upward, the shadow cast by the objects will change in size and position.
The shadow's size will increase as the light source moves further away from the objects.
Identify the initial position of the light source above the objects, casting shadows on the ground.
As the light source moves upward, the shadow cast by the objects will increase in size.
The shadow of the apple will grow larger.
The shadow of the white flag and the chicken leg will also grow larger due to the increased distance from the light source.
The shadow of the apple will cover more area on the ground.
The shadow of the white flag and the chicken leg will cover more area as well.
Conclude the shadow changes: the shadow of the apple will cover more area on the ground, while the shadow of the white flag and the chicken leg will cover more area as well.
The shadow of the apple will grow larger, the shadow of the white flag and the chicken leg will grow larger.
